autoTutorScript.script: _user_, and Jordan, Welcome back. Today we will be learning new vocabulary.
_user_, and Cristina, Hello. New vocabulary? How will we be learning that?
Today we will be focusing on learning new vocabulary by using context clues. Context clues are hints in a text, which can help us understand the meanings of words we don't know.
For this activity, you will be matching vocabulary words with the more common words that mean the same thing.
First, you will read the sentence at the top. Pay attention to the word that is highlighted in yellow. That is the word you will be replacing and checking.
Next, you can hover over the buttons on the bottom part of the screen to replace and check each answer. Try hovering over an option now to see what happens.
When you want to pick an answer, just press one of the buttons to lock in your selection. It will turn yellow to show that you've selected it.
Please note that the example below is incorrect.
Alright, let's give it a shot.
_user_, I will reset this first question and you can try it out.

questions.prompt: The soldier returned from war a hero for his courageous acts in battle.
questions.correctAnswer: BRAVE

questions.prompt: Children cannot subsist on candy and junk food. They need healthy foods in their diet.
questions.correctAnswer: SURVIVE

questions.prompt: Kim's son was expelled from school for bullying other children.
questions.correctAnswer: REMOVED

questions.prompt: "After a hot shower, Grace rehydrated her skin with lotion."
questions.correctAnswer: MOISTURIZED

questions.prompt: "Bill often receives compliments for his above and beyond work ethic. On the other hand, Joe puts forth mediocre effort and receives little to no praise."
questions.correctAnswer: AVERAGE

questions.prompt: The baby's crying was relentless. It lasted into the night.
questions.correctAnswer: NONSTOP

questions.prompt: It was difficult for the plumber to locate the source of the leak.
questions.correctAnswer: FIND

questions.prompt: The birth of Michelle's daughter was a joyful occasion that would forever alter her life.
questions.correctAnswer: CHANGE

questions.prompt: Endangered species such as the Siberian tiger are scarce. There are not that many of them left.
questions.correctAnswer: RARE

questions.prompt: Lee anticipated a long and stressful work day. He was surprised it went by so quickly.
questions.correctAnswer: EXPECTED

questions.prompt: He wanted to acquire the newest pair of designer sneakers.
questions.correctAnswer: GET

questions.prompt: Please click the sentence that best relates to the word in blue.
questions.correctAnswer: 3 She would make sure players follow the rules of the game.

answers.answer: 1 what she knows about the sport.
2 The job would often require her to travel to sporting events.
3 She would make sure players follow the rules of the game.

answers.answer: 1 on the list to fill a referee position

answers.answer: 2 strong people to play and control these games
3 There are many things that a referee needs to be able to do well in the league.

questions.correctAnswer: 1 She believes she can do a good job.

answers.answer: 1 She believes she can do a good job.
2 can also do a lot of duties at once:
3 she still works in sales and has three children.

questions.prompt: Please click the sentence that best relates to the word in blue.
questions.correctAnswer: 3 Having different kinds of employees

answers.answer: 1 Blandino said the fact that she's a woman is a bonus.

questions.prompt: Please click the sentence that best relates to the word in blue.
questions.correctAnswer: 2 It was easy to get better jobs and make more money.

answers.answer: "1 good benefits, such as health care and retirement pay"
2 It was easy to get better jobs and make more money.
3 People felt pride in serving the country.

answers.answer: 1 Harmful budget cuts really hit workers hard.

answers.answer: "1 federal workers have now had their pay \""frozen,\"" without raises, for three years"

answers.answer: "1 Without government support, it may be difficult to put enough of their own money towards the future"

"2 The government loses people who know how to do everything from securing borders to curing diseases,"
